mct



struct machComm;
Single MIPS command

uint generateMask(int startingBit, int endingBit);
Generates mask of ones (1-bit) from starting bit till ending

string regTranslator(int register);
Translates register (0..31) into string with register names

string commandVisualisator(machComm command);
Generates output string for a given machComm

machComm commandTranslator(uint command);
Translates 32-bit command word into machComm

uint stringToInt(string command);
Translates string to command word

Params:
string command input string. If it starts with leading "0x", then in is being read as hexadezimal word, otherwise it will be interpreted as decimal number

Returns:
uint - command word

add more tests, wrap in try-catch block, because right now this function is the most weak part of the whole utility

int main(string[] arg);
A simple translator from machine code into MIPS-assembler commands It's buggy and ugly, but as starting point it will go
